thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Wednesday, 30 May 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: China's state council says to cut import tariffs on consumer goods - state media

author: Reuters Editorial
title: China's state council says to cut import tariffs on consumer goods - state media
text:
BEIJING, May 30 (Reuters) - China’s state council said it will cut import tariffs on a range of consumer products including cosmetics, home appliances and sports apparel starting July 1, state radio reported on Wednesday.
Premier Li Keqiang said separately that China’s economy was steady and improving but still faced challenges, state radio reported. (Reporting by Beijing Monitoring Desk Editing by Jacqueline Wong)
